column2:
TL;DR about Citadef:
- It's a .eth Markdown blogging platform.
- Accounts are represented by NFTs (we call it WNFTs - Website NFTs).
- The look is wacky, with lots of procedurally generated art.
- The platform is democratic, will be owned & governed by writers.
The 80-20 role hits Citadef hard, but it will be ready eventually, and soon I hope. https://t.co/XEh70VCkag

@papa_raw @LefterisJP @ENS_DAO @BrantlyMillegan His tweets were not LGBT-centered; he made strong statements about many other things, some including me.

It's all part of the catholic belief. I'm liberal secular, but my best friends are religious (Muslims, Jews, Catholics). We get along great because tolerance goes both ways.

@mixedground_xyz @ENS_DAO It's not an oligarch, the weights are not how many tokens voters have, but how many people let the delegates use their tokens to vote in their name.

This is politics of representation that the whole democratic world enjoys, not someone "buying their way".

Dude's officially insane.

https://t.co/0nNx7DH1Hk

@Sim_Pop @C1aranMurray @LefterisJP @ENS_DAO @BrantlyMillegan Can you elaborate? I don't get to the bottom of your opinion. 

It's not like Brantly let his faith get involved with ENS. We went 3 years of his activity without even being aware OF his faith (besides Twitter bio). It's others who dragged his religious views into the light.

ENS EP6 (electing a new director) is being divided into 2:

6.1. Removal of Brantly Millegan as Director of The ENS Foundation

6.2. Electing a new Director of The ENS Foundation

The vote on 6.2 will take place only if the 6.1 passes.

I'm probably going to vote 'no' on 6.1.

@countessofcoins Btw, we got a .eth websites Discord where people do experiments all the time.

https://t.co/fLvwMXzDt5
@countessofcoins Thanks!

@countessofcoins I don't mean to play it down - you can open there a blog and publish articles using markdown. 

But since it's an experiment, it's not gonna look as polished as Medium, and there are only basic editing features for the beginning.

@countessofcoins WIP in the last stages.

But it's really an experiment meant to try a few concepts. 

One concept is how to build a decentralized blogging platform. 

But another is a .eth platform which is owned by its users (so the platform is managed like a DAO).

@countessofcoins Thanks!

What we build is a .eth blog platform where the platform itself is ENS+IPFS, and the posts are written in Markdown.

So @avsa started a great thread with his ideas for public goods bounties for ENS.

I added several of mine regarding .eth websites.

You can also treat it as a "dream list" of basic projects the .eth web really needs now.

https://t.co/bfY6LA3TtG

Comment to @gitcoin on the "create new grant" process:

Asking where are we based and forcing us to choose one option doesn't cut it in crypto. We are equally divided between the Middle East, Europe, and Africa.
